stream_context.summary: Kaze reviews and expands the overworld plan, designs new star events (mainly Yoshi- and NPC-related), tweaks cave layout/visuals, and reports on recent optimisation and beta-test results.

development_findings.summary: Refactoring the audio engine sped up processing by ~12.5 %; further gains are still being discovered.
development_findings.quote: I sped up audio code again by 12.5 % at least and I'm still finding new improvements.

development_findings.summary: The overworld will hold 21 normal stars and at least 15 secret stars, bringing the total game target to 180+; Kaze is open to increasing this to 185 or even 200 if new ideas fit naturally.
development_findings.quote: Maybe we have to put like 185 stars in this game … maybe we put 200 stars in the game.

development_findings.summary: NPCs from completed worlds will appear on Yoshi’s Island hub and can trigger new stars, tying level stories into the overworld.
development_findings.quote: Once you do certain actions NPCs from the worlds would visit the overworld and I said I'm fine with that if they have a purpose.

development_findings.summary: Multiple Yoshi-centric star concepts were drafted: rebuilding houses, a harvesting minigame, and a timed egg-hatching event that rewards a star after real-time delay or high-star threshold.
development_findings.quote: Come back one hour or more of real time to get a free star … or if you have 170+ stars then he instantly has the star for you.

development_findings.summary: A Monty Mole blacksmith will unlock in the hub only after players beat the Monty Mole boss in Grandson Badland.
development_findings.quote: The Monty Mole Smith only becomes available after you beat the Monty Mole mission to Grandson Badland.

development_findings.summary: Goomba King retires to the beach post-boss and may lead to a humorous fishing mini-quest; presently a flavour NPC without a star.
development_findings.quote: I'm kind of imagining him to just like come to the overworld and sit at the beach and just start fishing … I don't see how he would lead to a star, but he is a very funny idea.

development_findings.summary: Booatrice (Boonard’s wife) cameo: she appears opposite the Bowser animatronic after all seven Rainbow Grotto stars; interaction grants coins, dialogue, and a new credit scene.
development_findings.quote: Talking to her just gives you 5 coins and a new Boonard text box … maybe a new credit scene for Rainbow Grotto.

development_findings.summary: The cave near Rainbow Grotto is being redesigned: one-way mirror window into the level, glowing crystals as only light sources, and a secret star that uses carryable crystals to reveal a platform path (later revised to zip-line concept).
development_findings.quote: The mirror into the Rainbow Grotto is one way. You can see through the mirror from this side and look into the level.

development_findings.summary: A new animation format (‘cauterinian’ / quaternion-based) is planned to enable squash-and-stretch; not implemented yet.
development_findings.quote: I am hoping to eventually get cauterinian animations in … but I haven't implemented it yet so it's not possible.

development_findings.summary: Recent beta tests: Course 3 judged solid; Course 11 revealed a crash tied to render-function experiments but confirmed design works.
development_findings.quote: I ran the beta test of Course 3 and it went pretty well … Course 11 … RAM corrupted itself at runtime, but what they did play so far showed that all our designs were working as intended.

development_findings.summary: Draft overworld currently ~10 k polygons; final target estimated 50–100 k, with drafting workflow letting Kaze shrink empty stretches efficiently.
development_findings.quote: Drafting allows us to just move stuff around very easily … the final overworld is probably gonna have almost 100,000 polygons.

development_findings.summary: Legal/technical note: still using Nintendo’s F3DEX microcode; a future PC port would drop the microcode to avoid licensing issues.
development_findings.quote: I still use FADX3 … if I was to ever make a PC port … the microcode would not be part of it, because the microcode has to be emulated anyway.

context_findings.summary: Kaze expresses philosophy on ‘critics’ dilemma’—reviewers overvalue quantity/features instead of raw enjoyment, citing Portal 1 vs 2 and Zelda comparisons.
context_findings.quote: You end up having to say that you prefer games that … you didn't enjoy as much, simply because your principles are off of what reality really is.

context_findings.summary: He supports selective, purposeful use of generative AI and views moral panic over AI art as overblown.
context_findings.quote: They say AI art has no soul … the soul is in the story, not the visuals.

context_findings.summary: Personal detail: Kaze mentions having an eight- to nine-month-old daughter and being mindful of what media she will consume.
context_findings.quote: I have an eight-month-old daughter … I definitely feel like I have to be careful with what she's gonna watch on TV so she doesn't get brain rotted.

context_findings.summary: Shows minor frustration about a delayed sponsored video because Squarespace coupon failed.
context_findings.quote: I was supposed to upload a video today, but Squarespace is slow as hell so my sponsor code didn't work and that sucks.

biobak.summary: Re-working Divine Dino Domain visuals; Kaze is waiting for this to inspire additional overworld ties.
Actively comments on colour ‘juiciness’ and pushes Kaze to experiment (e.g., daring idea to let mirror show level).

key_stories.title: The Yoshi Egg That Can’t Hatch
key_stories.summary: Kaze conceives a star where a Yoshi egg appears in the hub, begins hopping, and needs the player’s help to break free, rewarding a star later.
key_stories.challenge: Create meaningful Yoshi-centric overworld content that feels alive.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed mechanics: warmth items, waiting periods, player interaction; settled on breakable egg plus delayed reward or instant if late-game.
key_stories.outcome: Concept accepted and logged for implementation as one of the remaining secret stars.
key_stories.key_quote: The egg is ready to hatch but he can't get out … break him out and he will repay you.

key_stories.title: Mirror Window to Rainbow Grotto
key_stories.summary: The plain cave felt disconnected; team decides to make its mirror one-way so players physically see Rainbow Grotto from the hub.
key_stories.challenge: Convey spatial connectivity between hub and Course 3 without breaking level boundaries.
key_stories.process: Discarded reflection texture idea due to N64 limits; agreed on demolishing a wall and re-using the in-level mirror as a see-through window.
key_stories.outcome: Design note written: ‘The mirror into the Rainbow Grotto is one way.’ Implementation pending.
key_stories.key_quote: What if we break down an entire wall and that entire wall just shows the overworld?

key_stories.title: Unlocking the Monty Mole Blacksmith
key_stories.summary: After defeating the Monty Mole boss in Grandson Badland, a repentant mole sets up shop in the hub to aid the player.
key_stories.challenge: Reward narrative closure for that boss fight and populate the overworld with purposeful NPCs.
key_stories.process: Linked blacksmith appearance to boss completion via in-stream card notes.
key_stories.outcome: Event logged as an overworld star candidate or service point.
key_stories.key_quote: I'm sorry for being a dickhead, I will actually help you out now.

open_questions.context: Mentioned as potential overworld star but left undeveloped.

open_questions.context: Numbers floated from 180 to 200 depending on overworld ideas.

open_questions.topic: Microcode legality and PC port strategy
open_questions.context: Kaze still uses F3DEX; PC port would omit it.
